div.ab: Vetica, ossonoba, Egitania, Colimbiria, Beseo, Lamico, Caliabria, Salamantica, Abela, Elbora, Iabora, Cauria y otros.

4ta Provincia de Saracosta antes Celtiberia, montes de Ercabica y donde nace el rio Tajo, ambos lados del Ebro hasta dentro los montes de Albortat y Albaskenzes. sus ciudades Saracusta, Tarracona, Gerunda, Barciliona, Egara, Empuria. Ausona, Urgelo. Lerida. Tortusa. Wesca. Tutila. Auca. Calahorra. Bambolona. Tarazona. Barbastar. Acoscante, Amaya. Jacca, Segia y otras.

5ta Narbona que esta en tierras de Afranc. desde la falda oriental de los montes de Albortat, como descienden las vertencias hacia el mar de Damasco, entre los montes y la costa del mar hasta el rio de la ciudad Nemauso que entra en el rio Rodano. sus ciudades Narbona, Nemauso. Macalona. Lotuba. Elena y otras.
div.note: [... from previous page ...] Vetica, Ossonoba, Egitania, Colimbiria [Coimbra], Beseo, Lamico, Caliabria, Salamantica [Salamanca], Abela, Elbora, Iabora, Cauria, and others [Conde: 'otras']. 4th Province of Saracosta [Zaragoza], formerly Celtiberia, [from the] mountains of Ercabica and [i.e. to] the source of the river Tagus, on both sides of the [river] Ebro up to the Albortat [Pyrenees] and Albaskenzes [Basque] mountains. Its cities Saracusta [Zaragoza], Tarracona [Tarragona], Gerunda, Barciliona [Barcelona], Egara, Empuria, Ausona, Urgelo, Lérida, Tortusa, Wesca, Tutila, Auca, Calahorra, Bambolona, Tarazona, Barbastar, Acoscante, Amaya, Jacca, Segia and others. 5th [province] Narbona [Narbonne], which is in the lands of France. From the eastern side of the Albortat mountains [the Pyrenees], as they descend the slopes [Conde: 'vertientes'] towards the sea of Damascus [the Mediterranean], between the mountains and the sea coast to the river of the city of Nemauso [Nîmes], which enters the river Rhone. Its cities Narbona [Narbonne], Nemauso [Nîmes], Macalona, Lotuba, Elena and others. [Conde gives more cities here]
div.ab: Jusuf sent his son Abderrahman called Abulaswad. with an army of horse & foot to the Afranc frontiers under Ocaili cousin of Samail general of Syria & Suleiman ben Xibeb with Egyptian Troops to keep down the rebels who presumed on the internal feuds of the Moors in Spain.
O [symbol: triangle] Soliman son of Hixem & Abderahman remaind in the Court of the new Calif Asefa who was very kind to them till Sodaif came to Court & said this

lg.l: y tal vez bajo del brazo
Que por eso al lado esta
Y da de mano al azote
Hasta que de todo el orbe
It can be fixed with the sword
Which is why it is by your side
And it gives a hand to the scourge
Because it usually does not suffice
Of the people of Beni Omeya [the Umayyads]
There will remain no trace or sign.

div.ab: When the Calif heard this he ordered them both to be slain. 90 Knights of the Omeya Umayyad family had fled to the court of Abdala ben Aly – Asefah’s uncle, They were going to dinner with him when a liberto freedmanof the Beni Haxiam came into the hall with other verses Conde reproduces these verses as well, so that Abdala had them all killed on the spot. Tables were placed over them & the company eat over them still groaning: very pleasantly WG's comment - not in Conde. then dug up the dead Califs at Damascus & found Hixem intire whom he first impaled & then burned. Soliman ben Aly the other uncle of the caliph, Asefah did the same to the OmeyasUmayyads & gave them to the dogs till none remained. The verses mentioned Abdelxiamsi the original stock of Omeyas also Alhusein ancestor of Asefah, killed by Jezid & his body dragged & trampled by horses in streets. also Zaydi whose body Hixem impaled. also Ibrahim brother of Asefah who died in prison Vide verses some of them - [symbol: asterisk]See verses some of them - Linking to asterisk on pag 176, below (WG's page 27).
The Calif Meruan the last of the OmeyasUmayyads
The CaudilloLeader, Commander Nasir ben Seyar sent him advice of a rebellion thus ao 748. Excelentes the year (anno) 748. Excellent [verses - Conde's verdict]

lg.l: Yo temo que han de llegar
duerme a sueño suelto ū vela.
I fear that they have to come
Does not extinguish them in time
Will be neither mountain nor forest
But people, who lose their lives
I said, watching such a vision
Oh - who at a lesser distance

div.ab: Merwan lost 30,000 men in battle & the rest were drowned in the Forat (Euphrates), Meruan fled & again fled thro Egipt Saleh took him & sent his head to the new Calif Asefah who occupied the palace of the Califs in Cufa.
arrancado su lengua para embalsamarla una fuina la arrebató castigo divino por las impiedades que Meruan solia decir.
Asi Saleh referia en su carta y versos que escribio a su primo el nuevo Califa

lg.l: Dios te dio triunfo y victoria
Pues la arrastra y la devora

note.ab: Thus Saleh recounted in his letter and verses that he wrote to his cousin, the new Caliph

lg.l: God gave you triumph and victory
For the many blasphemies he has said
Drags it off and devours it -

div.ab: Jezid 3 years 6m. 3d Moavia ben Jezid 3 months, 4 Meruan ben Hakem. 9m 10 days. 5 Abdelmelic ben Meruan. 13y 4m. 6 el Walid son of Abdelmelic ben Meruan ben Alhakem conquered Spain built fine things in Damascus. reigned 9y.7m. 7th Suleiman ben Abdelmelic 4y 8m. 8th Omar ben Abdelaziz 2y 5m. 9th Jezid ben Abdelmelic 4y 1m. 10 Hixem ben Abdelmelic 19y 9m. his sons went to Spain persecuted by the Califas de Beni Alabas & reigned there. 11th El Walid ben Jezid ben Abdelmelic ben Meruan reigned 1 year 3m. 12 Jezid son of Walid, called el Nakis – 5m 12d. 13th Ibrahim ben Walid 4m & was deposed & died in rio Azabo when Calif Meruan lost the battle. 14 Meruan son of Muhamad ben Meruan ben Alhakem called el Giadi (Sciite)? 5y 10m 15d, killed in Egypt, Vide [symbol: triangle]See symbol above on same page
